short_description: Contributed to the development of the website for the GeoMundus Conference 2023, held in Castellón, Spain, with a focus on responsive design, UX/UI design, performance optimization, debugging, and effective team collaboration.
long_description: As part of the web team for the GeoMundus Conference 2023, I contributed to the development of the official website with a strong focus on front-end development. My responsibilities included building a responsive and semantic HTML structure, styling with CSS, SCSS, and SASS, and ensuring cross-browser compatibility. I optimized website performance by minimizing resources, optimizing images, and implementing lazy loading techniques. I prioritized user experience by designing intuitive navigation and accessible, user-friendly interfaces. I also handled debugging using Chrome Developer Tools and maintained high code quality through linting tools like Stylelint and Prettier in VS Code. Collaboration and project management were key aspects of my role, using Git for version control and Trello for task tracking, workflow planning, and team communication.

company_name: Geological Survey & Mines Bureau, Colombo, Sri Lanka.
short_description: Conducted geospatial analysis, ETL workflows, and geodatabase management using SQL, GIS, and remote sensing tools. Designed interactive maps, performed risk assessments, and automated data processes to support mining and environmental projects while ensuring regulatory compliance.
long_description: In my role, I was responsible for automating workflows for file and application movement using SQL, relational DBMS, and data dashboards, which significantly improved process efficiency. I gathered and processed geospatial data through GPS surveys, ArcGIS field tools, and Google Earth, maintaining geodatabases using ETL workflows. I converted spatial data formats such as KML to SHP and CSV to GeoJSON to enhance data usability. Additionally, I designed and developed interactive digital maps using ArcGIS tools to identify optimal mining areas and detect illegal mining operations. My work included conducting spatial queries and buffer analyses to assess nearby structures and highlight blasting risk zones for public awareness. I also provided GIS training and represented the organization in meetings with government agencies, private sector stakeholders, and international companies.

company_name: GSMB Technical Services (PVT) LTD., Colombo, Sri Lanka.
short_description: Led GIS and spatial analysis for Southern Expressway Extension project, using drone surveys, GIS tools, and data integration for decision-making and project management.
long_description: As a GIS Analyst on the Main Highway construction project—specifically the Southern Expressway Extension (ESEP3) in Hambantota, where extensive blasting operations were required to remove large rock formations—I was responsible for supporting geospatial analysis and mapping efforts. I conducted drone surveys to capture aerial imagery in hard-to-reach areas, enhancing data collection and site evaluation. Using ArcMap and AutoCAD, I performed buffer zone calculations, utility mapping, and spatial data analysis to inform project decisions. I also integrated GPS survey data into GIS platforms to develop geospatial models for planning and monitoring. Project progress was tracked using MS Project, and I worked closely with engineers and project managers to define requirements and deliver accurate geospatial outputs. Additionally, I analyzed large spatial datasets using spreadsheets, leveraging pivot tables and visualizations to organize data and extract actionable insights.
